type.context: HOUSING OF LABOUR WORKERS ON SUGAR   ESTATES ACT under Interpretation. 2. In this Act  exporter means any person operating a factory in Guyana and manufacturing sugar for export;  labour worker means  (a)   any person engaged in manual labour in or about any work incidental to the cultivation of sugar cane and the manufacture of sugar; LAWS OF GUYANA 4 Cap. 99:04                        Housing of Labour Workers on Sugar Estates  L.R.O. 1/2012                                                 (b)  any person employed as a headman, foreman, sugar boiler, clerk or laboratory assistant or in any similar capacity in or about any work incidental to the cultivation of sugar cane and the manufacture of sugar;   (c)   any person engaged in the cultivation of sugar cane for sale to an exporter;  (d)  any  worker  employed  in  a  distillery  or  any  duly registered   sicknurse   and   dispenser   employed   by   an exporter;  (e) any driver of a motor-vehicle used for the transportation of sugar in bulk for export in bulk by an exporter;  (f)   any person employed as a foreman or clerk or in any similar capacity in or about any work incidental to the exportation of sugar in bulk by an exporter; and   (g) any person employed by the Demerara Sugar Terminals Limited, not being a person who is - (i)   a  director  or  manager,  or  such  other  person  (by whatever  name  called)  who,  in  the  opinion  of  the Committee referred to in section 4, exercises managerial functions; (ii) employed in a professional or administrative capacity or a combination of both of those capacities;  (h) any person belonging to such class of persons engaged in the loading of sugar for export as the Minister may, from time to time, approve for the purpose by direction in writing. type.name: section
type.title: Exemption of certain leases from the provisions of section 13 of      c. 5:
type.context: HOUSING OF LABOUR WORKERS ON SUGAR   ESTATES ACT under Exemption of certain leases from the provisions of section 13 of      c. 5:3. (1) Any lease of immovable property to which this section applies for a term of twenty-one years or more, or for any term renewable at the will of the lessee indefinitely, or for periods which, together with the first term thereof, amount in all to twenty-one years or more, and any surrender, assignment or transfer thereof, shall have effect as if such lease, surrender, assignment or transfer had been passed and executed before the High Court in the manner specified in section 13 of the Deeds Registry Act.  (2) This section applies to any lease (including any surrender, transfer or assignment thereof) granted to any labour worker   (a)   in respect of any immovable property owned by the Committee referred to in section 4 or by any company engaged in the manufacture of sugar or in the cultivation of sugar cane;  (b)  by the State in respect of any immovable property to which, but for the conveyance to the State of the title thereto by the Committee or by such a company, as is mentioned in paragraph (a), the foregoing provisions of this section would apply.  (3) The parties to a lease, surrender, assignment or transfer as referred  to  in  subsection  (1),  shall  forthwith  cause  such  lease, surrender, assignment or transfer, as the case may be, to be filed as of record in the Deeds Registry and pay such fees as may be prescribed under the Deeds Registry Act, save however, that notwithstanding anything to the contrary in any law the failure to file such a lease, surrender, assignment or transfer, made prior to the coming into operation of this section, shall not affect the validity of such lease, surrender, assignment or transfer.
